author: wsjcom
title: Axel Vervoordt’s Favorite Things
text:
“My dear friend Shiro Tsujimura, one of the best potters in Japan, made the vase in the back. I cut the branch myself. I never take the most beautiful branch of a plant. Instead, I want the one that hasn’t developed well, the one that’s had a difficult life—I appreciate the beauty in the imperfection.”
“I found the stone in front of the vase while walking in Utrecht, in the Netherlands. The stone was made by nature and age, not by humans. It appears in my new book, Axel Vervoordt: Stories and Reflections.
...
